Chinese Style Pancakes with Hoi Sin Chicken and Mexican Style Pancakes with Avocado Salsa

Ingredients for basic pancake batter
  • 180g / 6oz plain flour
  • 3 eggs
  • 350ml / 12fl oz milk
To serve:
  • lemon juice
  • sugar
Additional ingredients for Chinese style pancakes
  • pinch salt
  • 1tbsp/15ml sesame oil
  • 1tsp/5g five spice powder
  • 200ml hoisin sauce
  • 4tbsp/60ml soy sauce
  • 2tbsp/30ml sugar
  • 4 chicken breasts
  • 6 spring onions, shredded
Additional ingredients for Mexican style pancakes
  • 1 red chilli, finely chopped
  • small bunch coriander, roughly chopped
  • 2 avocados, stoned, peeled and sliced
  • 1 mango, peeled and sliced
  • 1 lime, juice only
  • pinch salt
  • 6tbsp/90ml sour cream
Method for basic pancake batter

  1. To make the basic batter, simply place the flour, eggs and milk in a bowl and whisk until smooth.

  2. Grease a frying pan and place over a medium to high heat. Pour large spoonfuls of the pancake mixture into the pan, and swirl until the mixture is evenly spread.

  3. Cook for two minutes each side or until lightly browned. Keep the pancakes warm.

  4. To serve: dredge each pancake with sugar and squeeze of lemon. Roll and serve immediately.

Method for the Chinese Style Pancakes

  1. Make up the basic batter as above.

  2. Add salt and five spice and stir well.

  3. Cook as above and keep the pancakes warm.

  4. To cook the hoisin chicken, heat a frying pan over a medium heat, add the hoisin sauce, soy sauce and sugar and cook for two minutes. Add the chicken, cook for five minutes each side or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is thick.

  5. To serve, roll the pancakes and cut into strips. Pile them, like strips of pasta in the middle of the serving plate. Top with chicken and scatter with the shredded onion. Drizzle the sauce around the edge and serve.

Method for the Mexican Style Pancakes
  1. Make up the basic batter as above.
  2. Add half the chilli and half the coriander. Mix well.
  3. Cook as above and keep warm.
  4. Prepare the salsa by mixing together the avocado, remaining chilli, coriander, lime juice, mango and salt.
  5. Spoon the mixture into the centre of the pancakes and drizzle with the sour cream.
  6. Fold the pancake over the filling in the style of a wrap. Serve immediately.
Hot Pancakes with Black Cherries and Chantilly Cream

(makes 12)

Ingredients
  • 175g/6oz self raising flour
  • 100g/4oz caster sugar
  • 1tbsp baking powder
  • 2 eggs
  • 275ml milk
  • butter
To serve:
  • 300g/10oz tinned black cherries
  • 1tsp arrowroot
  • 1tbsp chopped fresh mint
  • 125ml double cream, whipped
  • 2tbsp caster sugar
  • 1tsp vanilla essence
Method
  1. To make the pancakes, sift the flour into a bowl with the baking powder and caster sugar. Add the eggs and milk, whisk together but be careful not to over mix it.
  2. Heat a little butter in a non-stick pan and then add a tablespoon of batter for each pancake. You should be able to get three or four pancakes in the pan with a gap between each one. Cook them in batches until golden brown on both sides. Remove and keep warm.
  3. Drain the cherries, keeping the juice. Pour the juice into a pan and bring to the boil. Add a little water to the arrowroot and whisk into the boiling juice. Add the cherries and the chopped mint.
  4. Stir the sugar and vanilla into the whipped cream.
  5. To serve, stack the pancakes, three or four per portion, pour over the cherries and juice and top with a spoonful of the Chantilly cream.
American Pancakes with Crisp Bacon and Maple Syrup Ingredients
  • 175g/6oz self raising flour
  • 100g/4oz caster sugar
  • 1tbsp baking powder
  • 2 eggs
  • 275ml milk
  • butter
To serve:
  • 8 slices streaky bacon, cooked until crisp
  • 50ml maple syrup
Method
  1. To make the pancakes, sift the flour into a bowl with the baking powder and caster sugar. Add the eggs and milk, whisk together but be careful not to over mix it.
  2. Heat a little butter in a non-stick pan and then add a 2 tablespoons of batter for each pancake. Swirl the mixture in the pan, until it is evenly spread.
  3. Serve topped with the crisp bacon and maple syrup.

Published: July 22 2012
